As mentioned in this issue, redirecting data in powershell introduces some unintended alteration.
https://github.com/jtheoof/swappy/issues/51#issuecomment-662180488

## Steps to reproduce

It is problematic when handling for example image data being passed between applications as described there, but can also be reproduced by simply trying to copy a file using `cat`.

Simply create a `png` file called `in.png` and try to copy it to `out.png` wit the following command.

```powershell
cat in.png > out.png
```

## Expected behavior

The two file should contain exactly the same data.

## Actual behavior

Checking for differences reveals that the two files are not identical, also, the duplicate `png` file does not even open on my system.

```powershell
diff in.png out.png # Binary files in.png and out.png differ
```

Currently, PowerShell only knows _text_ when communicating with external programs - you cannot send raw byte data from an external program as-is through the PowerShell pipeline (which includes the use `... > <file>`, which is the equivalent of `... | Out-File <file>`

See #1908 and #5974,  and [this Stack Overflow answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/59118502/45375) for a workaround.
